title: 112_hr2234
content: The Act may be cited as the "Children's Act for Responsible Employment of 2011" or the "CARE Act of 2011." Definitions are amended. The Fair Labor Standards Act of 1938 is amended to define 'Oppressive child labor' as hazardous or detrimental employment for employees aged 14-17, with restrictions on hours and conditions to protect their well-being. Revised age requirement for child agricultural employment; repeal of waiver provision for hand harvest laborers. Revised age requirements for child labor in agriculture and non-agricultural employment under the Fair Labor Standards Act of 1938. Revised age requirements for child labor under the Fair Labor Standards Act of 1938, including the repeal of a waiver provision for 16 or 17-year-olds. Increased civil penalties for child labor violations. Increased civil penalties for child labor violations under the Fair Labor Standards Act of 1938, amending section 16(e) to change the penalties for violations related to serious injury, illness, or death of employees under 18 years old. Amending section 16(e) to include penalties for violations related to serious injury, illness, or death of employees under 18 years old. SEC. 5 amends the Fair Labor Standards Act to impose criminal penalties for repeated or willful violations of child labor laws resulting in death or serious injury to employees under 18 years old. SEC. 6 addresses pesticide-related worker protection standards. SEC. 6 prohibits the employment of children under 18 as pesticide handlers due to health risks. The Secretary of Labor can create rules to implement the Fair Labor Standards Act amendments within 30 days of publishing. Violations of the Act after the rules take effect will be subject to the amendments. State laws providing greater protections for employees will not be preempted by these amendments.
